name: TheAtlantic
text: "For people across a broad ideological terrain, Trumpism will be less an attractive political philosophy than a term of abuse," @PeterBeinart writes. "The best precedent is McCarthyism, which has become a synonym for hysterical intolerance." https://t.co/3tCUHyGudt

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I'm going to be the kind of congressperson where I’m going to be at rallies with the people, fighting for justice and being present," Jamaal Bowman, whom the Associated Press has said defeated incumbent Democrat Eliot Engel, told @IsaacDovere: https://t.co/4y06Hu2gfw

name: TheAtlantic
text: The grim effects of Trump’s wayward whims have turned Americans into a nation of armchair psychologists, struggling to understand the workings of one particular psyche, @megangarber writes: https://t.co/kjtvKWibC5

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Twitter—and companies like it—are essential to our national dialogue, to our economy, and to our democracy. We need to start treating them that way, and that means requiring them to do a better job on security and breaking them up," @schneierblog writes: https://t.co/FLWRNaNtSp

name: TheAtlantic
text: For all the existing vulnerabilities the coronavirus has exposed, it has also revealed how easily seemingly intractable problems can be fixed—with enough political will, writes @YasmeenSerhan: https://t.co/GQqOftThVX

name: TheAtlantic
text: A first-in-the-nation law in Colorado aimed at police accountability has activists celebrating and officers worrying, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/EI8y9QLd54

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Courage in the public square is very rarely about unearthing an epic wrong and seeking to right it; finding a pit of dastardliness and uncovering it for all to see," @EliotACohen writes: https://t.co/PXhDW1Gblp

name: TheAtlantic
text: Listen to @olgakhazan explain how nursing homes came to account for over 40% of U.S. coronavirus deaths: https://t.co/KurAQUWW9Q

name: TheAtlantic
text: Two of our writers discuss the fallout so far—and detail the scary consequences still to come. The latest Atlantic Daily: https://t.co/89AYndwc9e

name: TheAtlantic
text: The “song of the summer” usually arises from a shared, in-person culture. Without that, @skornhaber asks, can songs by DaBaby, Lady Gaga, or Megan Thee Stallion claim the title? https://t.co/DC0O06dEHf

name: TheAtlantic
text: "A story, for me, must be shaped and articulated through strong craft choices, but at the same time, it must suggest the wayward incoherence of life." Marisa Silver talks with Thomas Gebremedhin about the meaning of our actions and choices: https://t.co/s2l4oKaRGO

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Solving an economic crisis like the one the U.S. faces requires both a clear-eyed diagnosis of the problem and a commitment to cushioning the blow for communities, small businesses, and workers," @jleibenluft writes: https://t.co/x92Ca3mh0M

name: TheAtlantic
text: In 2018, John Lewis shared with Vann R. Newkirk II how Martin Luther King Jr. recruited him into the civil-rights movement and what it was like to know the iconic activist. https://t.co/3Qhas3JnMC

name: TheAtlantic
text: Photos of the Week: Noble Deer, Deadman's Reef, Buffalo Float—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/bzXWYY1ZN9

name: TheAtlantic
text: .@jameshamblin & @katlwells talk through the latest on how we get to herd immunity: https://t.co/CeRDu9tWCv

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YasmeenSerhan: “Although the coronavirus hasn’t solved Britain’s homelessness problem outright, it has proved what many within the housing and charity sectors have known to be true for years: that ... governments can bring people off the streets.”
 https://t.co/gPddpX8INk

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdamHSays: “Imagine if we had really listened to John Lewis?” https://t.co/VTPzu1M92O https://t.co/d2uzxAYh4k

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @RonBrownstein: As I've often said, Trump governs as a war-time president, w/blue America, rather than any foreign country, as the adversary. The aggression in Portland underscores how literally he might express that impulse in a second term-or even this fall.  https://t.co/75KDkLyyTy

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: “But there is still one more thing I have to do. I have to do something to make the world more beautiful.” https://t.co/S1F1uqhuiZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @IsaacDovere: .@realcpaz on what awaits whichever woman Biden chooses in the next few weeks https://t.co/jUDUEs0iwy

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @edyong209: “He challenged not only his enemies, but also his allies—those who broadly supported the movement for rights and equality but did not go far enough in eradicating inequities.”  

Important maxim from a beautiful piece by AdamHSays on John Lewis.

https://t.co/HXgMbKlTXE

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @SwatiGauri: “Absent their sacrifice, their bravery, and their brilliance, America would remain a white man’s republic, not a nation for all its citizens.” Adam Serwer on John Lewis and C.T. Vivian https://t.co/zWJdfkJxgP

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdamHSays: "I think it's important that when you see something that is not right, not fair, or not just, you have a moral obligation to say something to do something" https://t.co/EhG4xGvGMV https://t.co/hMRFLi0GhF

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: A prophetic piece from John Lewis (from @TheAtlantic, 2014):
https://t.co/ERGN6nX80q

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YasmeenSerhan: Britain’s success in shielding its unhoused population from the worst of the pandemic is to be lauded, but it also raises a question: Why did it take a pandemic for this to happen?

https://t.co/gPddpX8INk

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @realcpaz: I wrote about Joe Biden’s future Vice President; whoever she is, she’ll play a historic role in leading the country if they win come November.

@TheAtlantic https://t.co/9HmvIP4uSG

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @nora_kelly: “There’s just no chance that the person who he picks is not a consequential vice president or consequential historical figure. They just will be.” Sharp, convincing piece here from @realcpaz, laying out the stakes of Biden's VP choice: https://t.co/bj4IuHgTZt

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @julieebeck: there’s an assumption that people who are holed up with nuclear families right now have it best, in terms of not being lonely. but as @LenMandy shows, people are so much more creative at caring for their loved ones and building communities 
https://t.co/5q4QfinVFQ

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I have / many mothers, you see? Some gone on / but still sitting at the bus stop / as their half-life selves": https://t.co/STmQVm1IE8

name: TheAtlantic
text: If Joe Biden wins in November, his vice president is likely to have a level of influence over American politics that modern veeps have never had, @realcpaz writes: https://t.co/OBy3C2wrQB

name: TheAtlantic
text: "A new story doesn’t mean that we discard all the elements of the old story, nor does it mean that we dwell only on our sins. Instead, we narrate our national beginnings in light of our contradictions and our aspirations," @esglaude writes: https://t.co/nNTQ7MWzGb

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Evidently, in almost all of the justices’ view, it is far more appropriate, and raises far fewer concerns, for a state grand jury to investigate the president than for the United States Congress to do so," Robert Black writes: https://t.co/3Inh1B6DZx
